medical_history.history_of_present_illness: One week prior to admission, the patient noticed a sudden onset of diffuse, severe abdominal pain accompanied by fevers, rigors, and yellow non-bloody emesis multiple times per day. Symptoms gradually and partially resolved over 6 days but with lingering achy abdominal pain. Today, symptoms significantly worsened with a temperature of 103, recurrent rigors, nausea, and vomiting.
medical_history.past_medical_history: NASH cirrhosis (MELD 14), GERD, hypothyroidism, questionable cardiac history with prior ischemia, open hysterectomy for dysfunctional uterine bleeding, open cholecystectomy, and open appendectomy.
